p: Amongst the 682 upper respiratory tract specimens, 20.2% (138/682) tested positive for at least one respiratory virus. Influenza A and B represented respectively 4.4% (30/682) and 4.0% (27/682) of infection. Rhinovirus (HRV) and Respiratory Syncytial Virus were respectively detected in 8.4% (59/682) and 3.8% (26/682) of respiratory specimens. Both were significantly more detected in children less than 5 years (p-values of <0.001 with RSV and 0.03 with HRV).
